second hand.translation[0].definitions[0: the long thin piece of metal that points to the seconds on a clock or watch
second hand.translation[1].definitions[0: if you get something second hand, it is not new and has been used by other people before
We got most of our furniture second hand.
second hand.translation[1].definitions[1: if you hear something second hand, the person who tells you is not the person who originally said it
It may not be true – I only heard it second hand.
second hand.translation[1].definitions[2: if you experience something second hand, you experience it through other people, rather than directly
second hand.translation[2].definitions[0: second-hand things are not new when you get them, because they were owned by someone else before you
secondhand store/shop etc (=a shop that sells second-hand things)
second hand.translation[2].definitions[1: second-hand information or knowledge is told to you by someone who is not the person who originally said it – used to show disapproval
second hand.translation[3].definitions[0: not new, and having one or more previous owners
Imported second-hand vehicles could eat into the demand for new cars.
